name: Hard Descriptions of Famous People Quiz / Test | Mixed People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which World War Two leader was referred to as 'old blood and guts'?
questions.explanation:
Patton.

	The real George C Scott was apparently a real pistol.

questions.text: Which American politician who lived from 1777-1852 was known as 'The Great Compromiser'?
questions.explanation:
Henry Clay.

	Douglas was known as the 'Little Giant'.

questions.text: Which writer was known as the 'Belle of Amherst'?
questions.explanation:
Emily Dickinson.

	A one-woman show for Julie Harris.

questions.text: A biography of which screen legend was entitled 'More Than A Woman' - a tribute to her incredible career and extraordinary life?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	She did it all.

questions.text: A biography of which actor was appropriately entitled 'The Man Who Kept the Secrets'?
questions.explanation:
Peter Lawford.

	He was one of the last to speak to Marilyn Monroe before her death and, as a ratpack friend of Sinatra and a Kennedy in-law, he may have known some very interesting things.

questions.text: 'He has written some things quite the best of their kind ... but the heart somehow seems all squeezed out by the mind'. This was said about whom?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Allan Poe.

	The poet Lowell said it about Poe during Poe's lifetime. Poe was not pleased.

questions.text: Books about which U.S. president were entitled 'Arrogance of Power' and 'Abuse of Power'?
A good title for a biography of which U.S. president would be 'Socks, Sax and Sex'?
questions.explanation:
Bill Clinton.

	Socks is the pet. You can figure out the rest.

questions.text: Russia was (loosely) described as "a riddle, wrapped in a mystery, inside an enigma" by which man?
WWII : who was referred to as the 'Angel of Death'?
questions.explanation:
Mengele.

	This doctor had his own interpretation of the Hippocratic oath.
